citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An IACUC approved animal use proposal dated 4-10-24 involves a surgical procedure to put an implant under the skin of
6 goats, but there is no description in the proposal of how this will be done. The manager of the facility states that local
anesthesia was used, a small incision was made, and the implant inserted through that incision. There is no description of
this procedure, or any mention of how the implants are placed in the approved proposal. In order to evaluate an animal
use proposal and its impact on the welfare of the animals involved, the proposal must include complete descriptions of the
proposed use of the animals.
Correction date: February 1, 2025

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
An IACUC approved animal use proposal dated 4-10-24 involves making a skin incision to place an implant in 6 goats, but
there is no description in the proposal of how the procedures will assure that discomfort and pain will be limited to that
which is unavoidable or if there was anything used to address pain. The manager of the facility states that local
anesthesia was used before a small incision was made and the implant inserted through that incision. There is no
description of this procedure in the proposal and no description of the use of the local anesthetic. In order to evaluate an
animal use proposal and its impact on the welfare of the animals involved, the proposal must include a description of
procedures designed to assure that discomfort and pain to animals will be limited to that which is unavoidable for the
conduct of scientifically valuable research, including provision for the use of analgesic, anesthetic, and tranquilizing drugs
where indicated and appropriate to minimize discomfort and pain to animals
Correction date: February 1, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
